bwwExcerpt: Great divas never die; they just wait for the next Broadway revival. Nearly 70 years after faded star Norma Desmond swanned into pop-culture legend in Billy Wilder's classic 1950 film noir, she's still a spangled, endlessly quotable icon of Hollywood madness - and a delicious opportunity for any actress over 40 who knows her way around a big gesture and a bejeweled turban.
